conclusion: A particle is moving in a straight line along the x-axis, and its v-t graph is shown in the figure. The particle is located at x = 5 m at t = 0 and starts moving in the positive direction of the x-axis.
0 – 1 s velocity rises linearly from 0 to 2 m s⁻¹
3 – 4 s velocity falls linearly from 2 m s⁻¹ to 0
4 – 6 s velocity is –1 m s⁻¹ (motion back toward the origin)
6 – 8 s velocity rises linearly from –1 m s⁻¹ to 0

premise: 0 – 1 s velocity rises linearly from 0 to 2 m s⁻¹
conclusion: Displacement from 0 – 1 s is ½ (1 s)(2 m s⁻¹) = 1 m
Displacement from 1 – 3 s is (2 s)(2 m s⁻¹) = 4 m

premise: 3 – 4 s velocity falls linearly from 2 m s⁻¹ to 0
conclusion: Displacement from 3 – 4 s is ½ (1 s)(2 m s⁻¹) = 1 m

premise: Displacements from 0 – 1 s, 1 – 3 s, and 3 – 4 s

conclusion: Displacement from 4 – 6 s is (2 s)(–1 m s⁻¹) = –2 m

premise: 6 – 8 s velocity rises linearly from –1 m s⁻¹ to 0
conclusion: Displacement from 6 – 8 s is ½ (2 s)(–1 m s⁻¹) = –1 m

premise: Positive displacement subtotal and negative displacement subtotal
conclusion: Net displacement (0 – 8 s) = 6 m + (–3 m) = 3 m
